channel.description: Recent content in Probability on Luca Bruno blog

item.title: Probability of a union of independent events algorithm
item.description: Lately I was looking for a copy ’n paste algorithm to calculate the probability of a union of independent events that are not mutually exclusive (aka inclusion-exclusion principle in probability). Unfortunately I couldn’t find any algorithm for such a basic problem. Therefore, I decided to write the following naive algorithm which is fast enough for my purposes (O(n2) in time and space, where n is the number of events), and share with everyone:
